curam.util.orgtree.impl
Interface OrgTreeItem

All Known Implementing Classes:
OrgTreeJsonItem
public interface OrgTreeItem

The interface describes the public API, methods available when constructing the custom lazy loading tree loader. The API is described in terms of a single item in the tree which could be added to the desired place of the tree fragment being constructed by the descendant of the OrgTreeLoader class.

See Also:
OrgTreeLoader

Method Detail

addParam

void addParam(java.lang.String paramName,
              java.lang.String paramValue)
Adds the named parameter to the tree item and sets its value. The parameter=value pair gets appended to the URL query string from the node corresponding to this tree item.

Parameters:
paramName - the name of the parameter to be added to the item.
paramValue - the value of the named parameter.

getParams

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParams()
Gets the parameters of the current item.

Returns:
Map containing the parameter info for the current item.

inheritParams

void inheritParams(OrgTreeItem item)
Adds the parameters from the specified item to the current item.

Parameters:
item - OrgTreeItem to inherit parameters from.

addChild

void addChild(OrgTreeItem childItem)
Adds another item as a child item to the current one.

Parameters:
childItem - the tree item to be added as a child of the current item.

setLazyLoad

void setLazyLoad(java.lang.String loaderClass)
Marks the current item as being lazy loaded, which means that its children information is obtained later, by a separate request.

Parameters:
loaderClass - the name of the loader class used to construct the children information for the current item.

setSelected

void setSelected(java.lang.String selectedNode)
Marks the specified item in the tree as selected. Once loaded, this item should be highlighted in the tree and the appropriate page loaded. The selectedNode should specify the full path to the selected node in the tree in the format '/ancestorId1/../ancestorId#n/parentId/selectedNodeId'. If the method is used with null or blank string argument, the current item will be set as selected, the equivalent of using setSelected. Note that if selected information is set subsequently by any child items or siblings being added, the last occurrence will be used as the finally selected.

Parameters:
selectedNode - the path to the selected node.

setSelected

void setSelected()
Marks the current item in the tree as being selected. Once loaded, this item should be highlighted in the tree and the appropriate page loaded. Note that if selected information is set subsequently by any child items or siblings being added, the last occurrence will be used as the finally selected.

getOutput

java.lang.Object getOutput()
Produces and returns the tree item information in the format required by the specific implementation.

Returns:
Object implementation-dependent object representing the lazy loaded tree item fully rendered and ready to return to the client tier.
